Reviews.Title: 3 Reasons why the Xperia is better than the Iphone
Reviews.Author: N. Sanchez "ALeX"
Reviews.Content: After trying out various phones such as the iphone 3g, and blackberry tour I fell in love with this phone.Let me start out by saying that I liked the phone using the touchscreen so much that I felt like I didn't really need the keypad anymore which is a bummer. So yes the touch screen is very easy to use that not even the keyboard, which is the reason I bought it, is that useful. At times when you are writing a long text to write direction sure that can be very useful, but other than that the touch screen keyboard does a great job of saying your playful texts, invitations to your house party, or hellos. So it depends how much you are going to type. For right now I'm not sure whether it would've been worth getting the mini not this pro because its a little smaller and the touch screen works nice.Reason I got this phone over the Iphone 3GNow the reason I didn't like the iphone 3g is the qwerty touchscreen. After using a blackberry there was no way the iphone was easier to touch than the blackberry, because you don't get feedback. Some people like using the iphone keypad but who knows if they have used other phones. This is why I got this phone. This phone has a nice keyboard, and touchscreen. You get two worlds here. But like I said the touchscreen worked so nice even though this just has T9 keypad on the screen it works flawlesslyAlso after having the iphone what I liked about this phone much better is the ease of use. The iphone 3g is many times slower than this phone. However I'm not sure about the 3Gs it isn't the reason why I didn't like the iphone its just because of the keypad.Sound QualityThere isn't much to be said here. The quality sound much more fuller than the Iphone by far. So if you want to jam some music loud this is for you.Stand outMany people already have the iphone, those mytouches, the first thing I thought when I got the phone is this is going to stand out since it is many times smaller than your average phone, yet it does everything, well almost since there are some applications that don't work with this phone but I haven't encountered any that don't. You still have your common apps that work such as facebook. In the end this phone does not have that generic look many phones have, and is very stylish.CameraHands down to this phone compared to the iphone 3g. This is just as good as the camera on the Iphone 4 why pay more?QualityAnd to be really honest with you as far as the quality goes this really owns apple products. To me I think apple just raises prices to create a demand for the Iphone. For example the Iphone 4 has the same mega pixel camera as this phone does. And there are other phones that surpass the quality of the iphone 4 camera such as some other Sony Ericsson phones and droid phones. Just the look, feel and smell ;) is a winner for me. Guys this is Sony.True Unlocked phoneThere really isn't anything left to be said here.Data PlanThe Iphone requires a 30$ data plan from t-mobile to use the internet. This I can just use the basic 5 dollar a month internet and get 3g speeds.*Update actually I'm sorry guys but unfortunately I was misinformed. You would have to get the expensive data plan not just the simple internet fee.ComparableAnd some might say oh my gosh how dare you compare this to an iphone. The iphone has well there really isn't anything better unless you want to use imovie, or I don't know like that bigger screen then I don't know why you would prefer the iphone. And still this isn't a who has the bigger screen contest, there is the Samsung galaxy if you want a huge screen. The reason I didn't like it is because the touchscreen wasn't that responsive, and texting was actually hard to use.Wow factorI'm really surprised that this phone is not more popular. This fun is a very fun phone to use and to have around. I highly recommend this phone.And I'm not going to lie its hard to type on any iPhone whether its 4g, or 3g. There is just no feedback on the iPhones. Maybe if the iPhones make it easier to type like the android phones then just maybe I would switch but then again the iPhones are delicate phones, and they are expensive. So really I have been very satisfied with this phone, and I've had this for already about 6 months.Thank You Sony for giving me a phone that texts, and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Didn't actually keep it
Reviews.Author: O. Canto
Reviews.Content: The thing is, I got it thinking that it would work on AT&T; network, and while it did work with calls & messaging, it didn't with the 3G. But being fair (and that's the reason why I'm giving it a minimum of 3 starts) for the time I used it, it worked well & the seller (HasselFree) was really nice and accepted the return with no problem.The only input on the phone that I can give you is:- It's not as well made as the Nokia products that I have.- It's a good "cheap" option for anyone looking for a smart phone- It doesn't work with 850/1900/2100 band (AT&T; 3g). I thought it might, but the one that does work is x10a (the one sent was U20i).

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with X10 Mini Pro
Reviews.Author: Andrei Correia
Reviews.Content: I never had an smartphone before. So, I'm very happy with this one!!It's a small smartphone that contains everything I need and also, having an ANDROID S.O. I can download or purchase apps for it. The QWERT keyboard isn't too small for fingers; I preferred that try this one.I believe that by having a touch screen battery consumption is faster... But works very well!!!It's unlocked and works very well with the SIM CARDS tested... I'm using one now from T-mobile.About the looks it's fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect phone
Reviews.Author: Adrian Rivera
Reviews.Content: Hello, this is an almost perfect phone for its size, but like many users have mentioned, the battery runs out very quickly. Everything else it's good, signal reception, sound quality and display. The keyboard it's very handy. Also the Android OS lets you enhance it with a lot of apps (It comes with Android version 2.1)

Reviews.Title: Great LITTLE phone.
Reviews.Author: W. Manro
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to use on the AT&T; network.  I do NOT have a data plan since I bought it to replace the POJ phone that my employer gave me.  This is a VERY small Android phone.  I have found that the small screen combined with the keyboard is a winning format.  Trying to type with the on screen keyboard is impossible.Pro: Small size, nice little keyboard, good (but not awesome) performance.  Supports 16gb SD card, good quality screen, good voice quality, speaker phone is nice and loud, good WiFi performance, nicely responsive touchscreen, generally quality feel.Con: stuck with Android 2.1 (not addressing custom roms), no flash support, screen is quite small, battery longevity (keep wireless off and it's much better), sometimes keyboard is squeaky for some reason, screen does wash out in bright light.Overview: I'm quite happy with this phone.  I use it in conjunction with my HP Touchpad so I don't need to carry a massive phone.  I'm a total fan of this little phone.  Just to reiterate.  This is a SMALL phone, if you want a big ole screen this is NOT the phone for you.**I'm not addressing any quirks of software, this is just a review of the hardware itself.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for a small smartphone
Reviews.Author: Donaldo Carmona U.
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent smartphone that comes very complete in a small package,  easy to use thanks to Android, and you can customize it with thousands of applications you can find at the Android Market.

Reviews.Title: Review for Sony Ericsson x10 Mini Pro
Reviews.Author: CanadianGirl
Reviews.Content: It's a good phone overall. I believe it's one of the smallest Android phone on the market to date. Don't let the size fool you, this phone is feature packed and makes texting very comfortable with the slide out keyboard. I'm one of the rare few that don't want a data plan with my phone so I appreciates it's wifi feature quite a bit. Please note that this phone is u20i, which is the international version. What it means is that it won't work with Canadian 3G network. Again, I don't plan on getting data so that really doesn't bother me. The camera is okay for what it is (I generally take photos with my dSLR and I also have a regular P&S;).Overall, it's a good little phone.

Reviews.Title: Sony Ericsson Xperia X10 Mini Pro Mostly Good
Reviews.Author: Shananigans
Reviews.Content: Not too many bad things to say about the phone. The touch screen is great. Getting apps from the droid store was very easy. The live wallpapers are awesome. Etc. However the downside is on the sides of the touch screen its hard to press whatever u r trying to press. Also if you have alot of widgets on the home screens or apps and if u have a live wallpaper..the phone slows down considerably.

Reviews.Title: great hardware/OS... battery not so good
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Vidal
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing little phone. As a phone, voice is clear on both ends. Android 2.1 comes with the phone and you only need to jump to android market to get a ton of applications. If you do SMS often, the default application is somehow limited, I suggest you download HandCentSMS, which is free.The QWERTY sliding keyboard is a great asset, so much, I have not yet used the virtual keyboard. The keys feel real and have a nice clack feedback. D/t the size of the phone, if you have fat fingers you might be in trouble.GPS/WIFI/Bluetooth. This phone has it all.D/t android, it has great integration with google products (google+,gmail, picasa, docs, etc)Only problem is the battery, if you play a bit too much with the phone, it won't last a working day.PROs: android, size, keyboard, gps/wifi/bluetooth, FM radio, PRICE!!CONs: battery too small

Reviews.Title: All in One
Reviews.Author: anfesa2002
Reviews.Content: First, Amazon.com is excellent. All the products I've bought have come out perfect.Sony ericsson xperia x10 mini pro, is a smartphone with everything you need, easy to handle, has an acceptable weight, the keyboard is excellent, the screen is sufficient, the camera is very good (I hope to have autofocus and more options), bluetooth, wi-fi, gps working ok.Contra: the battery lasts 2 days maximum, when you turn it takes a little bit. sometimes crashes and restarts.In summary, I think that is one of the best phones I've had and the price is ok. The Android system is excellent. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: Not Compatible
Reviews.Author: Monique
Reviews.Content: The device arrived sooner than expected - PLUS! Excited to use, the included charger did not meet standards and could not power on the device. Contacted the Shipper and received a response and seemed happy to assist, being apologetic...but I still have the charger and device, awaiting to return.I was sent an email to print out a FedEx label but did not get a chance to go and print it out..so again, stuck waiting to return a device that is not compatible with my wireless carrier.

Reviews.Title: peeved
Reviews.Author: kayblack
Reviews.Content: I'm ardent user of sony products: i got a vaio, a bravia, a ps3 and a sony shelf mini cd player with ipod connectivity. thus i first hand the quality of sony products but boy was i disapointed with this phone!! i don't really know if it was a software or hardware problem but the fone started freezing every min after about 40 days of usage. i always got  into altercations with people blaming me for not picking up their calls cuz the fone had a habit of freezing everytime i got a call. 2ndly, the battery discharges faster than it charges and then it decided it wont charge at all!!! 3rdly it is slower thn it size (literally), it takes forever to process basic fxns which is the moat annoying part. I'd wanted to sell it back to amazon but i know they'll just change the packaging and ship it to another unsuspecting buyer so i gave it to the electronic recyclers cus i feel that is where this junk belongs!!!

Reviews.Title: tough, reliable, quality piece of hardware
Reviews.Author: Pack Leader
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for 1 year and I'm writing my review with it. I am very pleased with this phone. For the performance and features it must be one of the best. Everything works quite well and I defer to the other positive reviews. It is not perfect but I can live with the minor flaws I've encountered. These are: force close issues when opening a draft message, accidentally tapping the language button during texting, overly sensitive screen when web browsing, no camera zoom, camera shot sound has disappeared (even after a reset), sometimes all audible tones disappear but can be restored using the reset feature (without losing your data).I have dropped this phone, it has slipped out of my shirt pocket into a pond, and it has been splashed with salt water. It has recovered fully in all cases. I did have to use a needle and dielectric grease to restore the data connection terminal after the salt water incident.The keypad is somewhat cramped but if your fingers aren't overly large you'll be fine. Love the wifi and option to have data service plan when I need it (ATT).All considering a great phone! So good I just bought my daughter the sk17a model and she loves it. You

Reviews.Title: pretty good
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: This phone works very good, the only time u cant use it is when it's charging, because the screen freezes when u try to unlock or if u press something it will cause the screen to go crazy.. other than that its a good phone, i just charge it at night when i wont use it..

Reviews.Title: Great phone in a small package
Reviews.Author: C. Waters
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of owning this phone for over a year.  I am currently ordering a replacement digitizer so that I can continue to get life out of this phone.  When I had searched for a Phone, I was looking for small size, physical qwerty, 5+ camera and touch screen.  This phone fit all of this perfectly.  I have been able to get a lot of use out of this phone both in the states and outside.  I have never had any major issues with the phone, it still slides perfectly as the day I bought it.  I've put this through a lot of abuse over the year and it keeps on trucking.So if you are looking for a few simple things in a phone and don't want a 4" brick in your pocket, this or it's follow up the SK17a would be a great choice.I will mention that I do not have a data plan, most places now have wifi and I have separate navigation because I don't want to carry around a 4" phone just to use my navigation once a year.  I just really don't need to stay connected to people that often when I'm not around some wifi anyway.  Texting works just great for those places where there is no wifi.What do I like:-size, the 2.5 screen is designed well and fits perfect into your hand-takes great pictures if you aren't looking for 1500$ camera pictures-the well thought out physical qwerty, I rarely need keys that aren't already there-the microSD slot, don't have to upgrade my phone because I want more space-**plug and play ability for music, I'm constantly adding/taking away music with just sliding folders over, no extra software-built in stand for standing the phone on its side, you'd be surprised how often you use it when its there.-gmail sync-google voiceWhat I don't like:-This phone can be very sluggish at times especially when texting quite a bit-**referring to the ease of adding music which I like, the music player is terrible for setting up playlists and the software makes it so you have to sync up your library again and its just a hassle, if you use iTunes, get doubleTwist and save yourself some headaches-you only get 4 options on the main screen, choose wisely-my contacts and calls are in two separate programs, taking up two of my four spots when they could easily take up one. I could have just the one for calls but I do use the contacts enough that I don't like having to go down a page and then click, its not essential but it is annoying for how I use this phone.-battery battery battery... it's life is terrible, keep the chargers (yea you are going to need at least 2) very close if you talk on the phone a lot-moving icons around is a nightmare at times, I imagine this can happen on any phone but the compact screen makes for an extra fun nightmare-DO NOT even turn this phone on without a screen protector, don't get me wrong the phone can take a beating but the screen scratches very easily, seriously admire it from inside the wrapping until you have a clean room and a screen protector to put on it.-The texting screen is a bit cramped with a huge box for language at the bottom that is just unnecessary and the whole contact coming down randomly from the top, you are lucky to get two lines of text in between them.In conclusion I will say that I enjoy this phone very much even with all of its quirks and I will likely look into getting the SK17a or something similar after this phone has run its course.  I think that the phones of today have gotten too big for their use and I really like using my phone for just that, a phone.  It's not a TV or a video console so lets not try to turn something into something it is not.  It boils down to use and while I do wish this phone had better battery life, be less sluggish (faster processor) and a bit better design of the OS, I believe the SK17a has resolved all of these issues.

Reviews.Title: The worst phone I've ever had
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: Only 1 month of life, thats was the period of time I can used it without any problem, one day suddenly, the phone turned it off by itself and no matter what I tried, It never reignited again. Apparently it's a problem with the Android version in it and the bootloader, or thats what the other people with the same problem says (No official words about from Sony Ericsson).I contacted the seller (HassleFreeCel) in order to find a solution for my problem, and they said I have to call SE for the warranty effects. I'm in Colombia and the limited warranty clearly says that the user have to contact the dealer/seller when appear problems with the product. Call SE contact center in my country, and they told me I have to contact the seller because they don't respond directly for products defects. Mailed SE USA, and they (stupidly) asked me to do the same things I had done in many times with the phone and the PC Companion. HassleFreeCel firmly says they don't have to respond for warranty.Abstract: I lost my money, my time, my patience and my confidence in third-party sellers like this one.Don't buy this phone!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: RooiValk "IRW"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a compact Android phone, this is a great buy. So far I've had no issues with it - doesn't crash or reboot, so that's always a plus :). The battery life, on the other hand, is attrocious. I've never left it long enough without charging but I would be surprised if it made 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: Small, compact smartphone
Reviews.Author: Sphynx
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as a replacement for another Xperia Mini Pro after the touchscreen broke, so I knew exactly what to expect.  It's functionality is comparable to the iPhone and other similar brick-like products that you see in nearly everyone's hands these days, but this phone stands out because of its much smaller size and its unique design.  This definitely won't be mistaken for an Apple product.

Reviews.Title: batery`s horrible
Reviews.Author: rinku
Reviews.Content: this cute luking smartphone is definetely meant for all those who are luking for a handy sleek classy n a palm sized android phone..but surely the battery is sumthing 2 complain about..wid 1 minute of usage it reduces by 1 percent..what can be worse..i wonder if amazon has supplied me the original one..hopping to get a favourable response..

Reviews.Title: Great Phone in a Small Package
Reviews.Author: Travis Ray Downey
Reviews.Content: This phone is tiny! But it is very useful. Same minor flaws. Contacts other than the ones on your phone cannot be personalized. Battery life drops drastically when using all its features.But it is definitely worth buying!!!

Reviews.Title: Pohne comes to Bogota
Reviews.Author: Camilo Salazar
Reviews.Content: I was purchase the phone one month ago (U20i) and comes with all the accesories (includes a electricity rounded conectors adaptor), android 2.0.1 and full working. No problems with any thing an the phone are really good. (no 3G Navigating but i know it!! ).

Reviews.Title: Nice phone, great delivery
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Its a nice Android phone with very friendly qwerty keyboard. It has a nice display and feels good in hand.

Reviews.Title: Like size, but hate software.
Reviews.Author: J. Dunn
Reviews.Content: I like the small form factor of this smartphone with sliding keyboard.  However, the phone is very confusing to operate.  It's unlike any phone I've ever used.  I kept thinking, just give it time, and I'll get used to it..but, no...the software is just not user-friendly.  It's as if an engineer purposefully set out to 'reimagine modern phone workflow'. But, the small size is so important to me, as if fits comfortably in my front pocket, that I've just accepted the confusing and frustrating software workflow, and will just have to deal with it..for now.

Reviews.Title: overall good phone
Reviews.Author: XanTheGreat
Reviews.Content: it has everything a semi knowledgeable person needs from a cell phone, a problem it has is that when you connect it to your pc it will shut down and ask for a pin over and over again unless you leave the default tone 'tinkerbell' or set it in silent mode, how can something that easi get so wrong??

Reviews.Title: The received product is not the offered one!!
Reviews.Author: Juan esteban Palacios isaza
Reviews.Content: They offered the sonny eericcson U20a and the model that receipt was the U20i that does not serve in my country. I feel cheated

Reviews.Title: Too small...
Reviews.Author: Saravanan Gnanasekaran "Saravanan"
Reviews.Content: Hi,I was expecting a lot from this phone.This was too small in size for my expectation.They could  name it  as Extra mini pro....Otherwise the phone was good.I had returned the same day when I received the phone.I would recommend Xperia X8 rather  than this one.If you are expecting an ultra small Android Phone.Here u go.This phone is for you...

Reviews.Title: lovely
Reviews.Author: sweety
Reviews.Content: This phone's battery life is very poor and it used get shut down during a call. Screen resolution is of too bad quality. I would not recommend this phone to anyone.
